DOC.brief_summary: This randomize , double-blind , multicenter , repeat-dose study fix dos Q8003 12 mg/8 mg give q6hr compare morphine sulfate 24 mg oxycodone hydrochloride 16 mg give q6hr management acute moderate severe postoperative pain 48 hour follow bunionectomy surgery .
DOC.brief_title: Comparison Safety Q8003 Versus Morphine Equivalent Doses Its Components ( Oxycodone Morphine ) Bunionectomy Patients
DOC.criteria: Patient male female least 18 year age . Females must nonpregnant , nonlactating , practice acceptable method birth control , surgically sterile postmenopausal ( amenorrhea ≥ 12 month ) . Nonpregnancy confirm pregnancy test conduct Screening Pretreatment . Patient schedule bunionectomy surgery , meet criteria ASA Class I III , willing stay study center least 48 hour initial dose study medication post surgery . To randomize surgery , patient must report moderate severe pain ( score 2 4 point Likert scale 4 11 point NPRS scale ) . At least 40 % study subject 60 year age old . In opinion Investigator , history pulmonary , cardiovascular ( include uncontrolled hypertension ) , neurologic , endocrine , hepatic , gastrointestinal , kidney disease therapy would jeopardize patient 's well participation study mentally emotionally unsuitable participate , unable/unwilling comply study assessment . Used opiates continuously ( include tramadol ) ten day past year . Hypersensitivity poor tolerance acetaminophen . Currently receive medication stable dose ( dose > 2 month prior date surgery ) . Was dose another investigational drug within 30 day prior Screening Visit previously receive treatment Q8003 . Current therapy central nervous system depressant medication might increase risk treatment opioids ( used surgical anesthesia ) . Current evidence alcohol abuse ( regularly drink 4 unit alcohol per day ; 1 unit = ½ pint beer , 1 glass wine , 1 ounce spirit ) .
